intro: Manisuris thyrsoidea, commonly known as the slender thyrsoid, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stem and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical environments.
